channel.title: Scss on Choly's Blog
channel.description: Recent content in Scss on Choly's Blog

item.title: Compile CompassApp on Ubuntu 11.04
item.description: 1. Install RVM bash < <(curl -s https://rvm.beginrescueend.com/install/rvm); echo 'if [[ -s "$HOME/.rvm/scripts/rvm" ]] ; then source "$HOME/.rvm/scripts/rvm" ; fi' > ~/.bashrc rvm install 1.9.2 2. Install jRuby rvm install jruby cd ~/.rvm/bin/jruby-1.6.4 -S gem install rawr 3. Get and Compile CompassApp git clone https://github.com/handlino/CompassApp.git cd CompassApp bin/build-all.sh 4. Run CompassApp cd package/compass.app/ ./run.sh

item.title: Formalize [More Compass]
item.description: I think forms and all things related ( inputs, buttons, etc… ) are probably one of the more annoying things when building a website. They’re just not consistent and it takes a lot of effort to make them look decent. I spent some time looking for a tool to help me with this and I ended up with formalize which comes as a compass plugin and integrates with any web framework you’re using.
